resources.string:
"by Jack Twilley -- mathuin@gmail.com
 New features in 2.0 include local offset and position formatting preferences.
 There is now a Facebook page for HFBeacon so please visit the page and leave feedback on how you use HFBeacon!
 Next on the feature list is localization: volunteers are needed for all languages -- especially Spanish, French and German. Thanks again!
 HFBeacon is a simple application which informs the user which HF propagation beacon is transmitting at the present time. Beacon information was collected from http://www.ncdxf.org/beacons.html. HFBeacon is open source software released under the MIT License.
"
Ranges and bearings will be displayed as soon as the application retrieves your current position.\n\nShould be just a moment!
To use HFBeacon, you must first turn on a Location source in Settings. Go to Settings and turn it on now?
